message:
With one more day to go in the present exam session, we hope you have had a good run. You can send your question paper to us, and we will upload it to MFQP. From now, until eternity, no one has to go into an exam hall clueless about what the questions will look like. Let's get together to make this a reality! Email images or a PDF of your question papers to metakgp-qp@googlegroups.com

MFQP: https://qp.metakgp.org

P.S. It really helps if you can use the CamScanner app and send us a PDF generated by that app. We appreciate the time and effort you put into this :)

story: Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's post.
message: Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's post. Whenever Apple releases a new version of the IPhone, a vast majority of users will flock to buy the current version, although previous versions are still well in use. This particular trend is observable in may real-life scenarios , recent publications are able to improve upon previously done work and hence relay in more citations, recent supreme court cases become famous because laws evolve and change with time. This dynamic evolution of networks is presented wonderfully in this video. Do give it a watch. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fhGewF4Xyo0&feature=youtu.be

As we all are aware of the reach out program to held today at 6:30 PM, but only some people know that something like this happened three years back too. Read about the whole history and events that took place at that time at https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Reach_Out_Week

Hola Folks! 
We are curating a list of all the Faculty Advisors, we have managed to get some names but still we have a lot of missing data. It is time for you to contribute towards the Wiki. It will take only a minute. We just need your FacAd's name, your department and your year of joining. 
You can contribute by:
1. Directly editing the wiki page at https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Faculty_Advisors_List (Preferred)

2. Filling the google form: http://www.ccode.ml/metakgp-FacAD

Together let us make the Wiki great. 
Cheers!

story: Metakgp with Abhishek Tripathi and 2 others.
message:
We are organising the second "MetaKGP Talks" on April 13th (7PM-8PM) at Maggu Room(F127, Main Building). There will be two talks:
1. Ashris Choudhury and Ankita Diwan (Final year B.Arch):
Speaking on “Building future together : Artists and Engineers”. The talk explores the messy process of creativity shedding light on how innovation is a blend of analysis and synthesis. Ashris and Ankita talk about the importance of collaboration and discussion between the engineers and artists to make innovation happen fluidly.
2. Abhishek Tripathi (Member at TLS):
Speaking on “Poetry, Collaboration and People - Sublimation of knowledge by doing and seeing”. The talk would be related to Abhishek's experience of learning from people, literature and history.
We hope to see you there with your friends!

story: Metakgp with Abhishek Tripathi and 2 others.
message:
We are organising the second "MetaKGP Talks" on April 13th (7PM-8PM) at Maggu Room(F127, Main Building). There will be two talks:
1. Ashris Choudhury and Ankita Diwan (Final year B.Arch):
Speaking on “Building future together : Artists and Engineers”. The talk explores the messy process of creativity shedding light on how innovation is a blend of analysis and synthesis. Ashris and Ankita talk about the importance of collaboration and discussion between the engineers and artists to make innovation happen fluidly.
2. Abhishek Tripathi (Member at TLS):
Speaking on “Poetry, Collaboration and People - Sublimation of knowledge by doing and seeing”. The talk would be related to Abhishek's experience of learning from people, literature and history.
We hope to see you there with your friends!

We are going to have the first 2 MetaKGP Talks on April 3rd (7PM-8PM) at Maggu Room (F127, Main Building).
We have two speakers:
1. Harsh Gupta (Participated in the Google Summer of Code 2014, volunteer with #SaveTheInternet Coalition) - Speaking on “Politics of Tech". The talk would be related to the speaker’s experience of working with “#SaveTheInternet” coalition that lead the pro-net neutrality campaign last year, against a proposed TRAI regulation.
2. Atal Ashutosh Agarwal (Former Vice President, Gymkhana) - Speaking on “Kgp learnings beyond Kgp's curricula”. The talk would be related to the speaker’s experience as the vice president of Gymkhana.
We hope to see you there with your friends!

We hope to see you there with your friends!

Naresh Ramesh, Athitya Kumar, Rameshwar Bhaskaran and Ayush Goyal from Metakgp, recently represented IIT Kharagpur in the Dashboard event of the 5th Inter-IIT Tech Meet, and won the Bronze medal. The Dashboard built, is being fine-tuned and will be released soon for usage. 

We'd like to congratulate the team for winning Bronze. For the attention of fellow developers, you can have a look at the Dashboard code here : https://github.com/ghostwriternr/dashboard-beta

Naresh Ramesh, Athitya Kumar, Rameshwar Bhaskaran and Ayush Goyal from Metakgp, recently represented IIT Kharagpur in the Dashboard event of the 5th Inter-IIT Tech Meet, and won the Bronze medal. The Dashboard built, is being fine-tuned and will be released soon for usage. 

We'd like to congratulate the team for winning Bronze. For the attention of fellow developers, you can have a look at the Dashboard code here : https://github.com/ghostwriternr/dashboard-beta

Election results are here:

1. Naresh Ramesh : (Condorcet winner:  wins contests with all other choices)
2. Nishant Nikhil : loses to Naresh R by 19–9
3. Ayush Goyal : loses to Naresh R by 18–10, loses to Nishant Nikhil by 14–13
4. Arun Patro : loses to Naresh R by 18–7, loses to Ayush Goyal by 16–11
5. Pranit Bauva : loses to Naresh R by 20–6, loses to Arun Patro by 15–12
6. Rameshwar Bhaskaran : loses to Naresh R by 22–3, loses to Pranit Bauva by 18–8
7. Sayan Sinha : loses to Naresh R by 22–3, loses to Rameshwar Bhaskaran by 14–9

29 out of 126 eligible voters casted their votes. The top three candidates,
Naresh R, Nishant Nikhil and Ayush Goyal will be maintainers of metakgp for
next one year, eight months and four months respectively.

Congratulations to new maintainers, we hope that metakgp will reach new heights under their leadership. Thanks a lot to all candidates who took out their precious time to participate in the election process.

BTW as a reminder to everyone, not being a maintainer doesn't stop you from taking initiatives. Metakgp is an open community, you can start your own projects, improve existing ones and make metakgp more awesome.

Please submit any (anonymous) feedback you might have about the election using this form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScgOaX0EET1HFJkGD3I3mqD0tTnQ3qRMu2UuOIOa7ECHorY_w/viewform
 and of course if you want to discuss something or just hangout with us, you can join us on our slack channel http://metakgp-slack.herokuapp.com/
